{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3156793,"name":"","username":"mdurrani834","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mdurrani834/{size}/131246_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-04T00:24:12.294Z","cooked":"

Hi all, we have been getting increased reports from teams saying that their PhotonVision settings (calibrations, pipelines, etc.) are being deleted upon power off randomly. We aren’t sure of a root cause of this (actively looking right now for fixes) but have some steps to help mitigate this failure mode.

Possible solutions include:

  1. Export your current settings (found in the settings tab) and check it into version control be ready to reimport if needed. Your drive team should know how to do this and you should add checking vision operation before every match.
  2. Alternatively, If you have spare time, and are not at a competition try this .jar via offline updateProperly assign camera index when connecting new camera (#819) · PhotonVision/photonvision@dcd9178 (github.com). It, along with some previous commits should help robustness.
  3. We are looking at moving to a more robust way of reading settings using atomic saves, but it is still very untested. If you are willing to be a beta tester, reach out to us on PhotonVision Discord. Your help is much appreciated.

We apologize for the inconvenience that this may cause, especially during Week 1 events, and are looking for a fix. If you have log files to share from when this happened, please send them our way.

If you see this, try to let other teams at your events that you see using PhotonVision know as well.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":58,"updated_at":"2023-03-04T00:25:09.726Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":435,"reads":771,"readers_count":770,"score":2554.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428823,"topic_slug":"psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision/actions/runs/4307943821","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Properly Vision resets configuration to default","clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-ftc-blog-introducing-the-future-mobile-robot-controller/475674/164","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"[FRC/FTC Blog] Introducing the Future Mobile Robot Controller!","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":15}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34970,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug/428823/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":15}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3156975,"name":"Matt","username":"thatmattguy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-04T11:28:28.818Z","cooked":"

To expand on this:

We think based on logs that what’s happening is that the robot is either power cycling in the middle of rewriting settings to disk, or the settings files aren’t being properly flushed despite our best effort to do so. The failure mode shows up as Photon being unable to parse a specific camera’s config JSON file (not malformed, just straight up missing based on logs). I have a PR open to use a SQLite database (high risk, can import configs from old to new), and another open to package all our settings up into a ZIP file and take advantage of atomic renames in Linux (lower risk, and tested by 5026 , but doesn’t yet auto import older formats of settings). If you want to try either I’ll happily support you in discord!

It’s just sort of a conundrum coz both of our current fixes are potentially breaking changes and aren’t exhaustively tested yet (n=2), so we’re hesitant to ship mid competition season.

(As an aside, this showing up now and not last year makes me think that something in our raspberry Pi Linux image quietly changed…)

For teams, would a mitigation strategy be to make the file system read only at competition? You couldn’t change settings, and logs wouldn’t work, but it might be a fair trade off.

Our first competition is this weekend and our plan is to use this MakerFocus UPS. Hopefully we can avoid the lost settings issue.

We’ve also seen some issues when the robot voltage dips. The Pi and PhotonVision keep running, but the camera hangs for several seconds. We’re hoping this will take care of it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":58,"updated_at":"2023-03-07T04:27:43.460Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":378,"readers_count":377,"score":85.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":428823,"topic_slug":"psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01LAEX7J0?ref_=cm_sw_r_apan_dp_6GF4E9AHWRK0DN6QWRCC","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":32}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug/428823/8","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3159021,"name":"Jason Johnson","username":"jsjohn2000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a88e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T04:30:29.910Z","cooked":"

File systems on SDCards don’t take well to power offs without properly shutting down the system.

Does PhotonVision application and OS for Raspberry Pi account for this and cleanly handle cases where power is disconnected?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":58,"updated_at":"2023-03-07T04:30:29.910Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":344,"readers_count":343,"score":78.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428823,"topic_slug":"psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug","display_username":"Jason Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51771,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug/428823/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3159143,"name":"Matt","username":"thatmattguy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T13:29:55.338Z","cooked":"

We do, at least far as I can tell, properly flush all of our files to disk as we write them. Clearly, that isn’t working though. What’s weird is that this issue showed up this season, which sort of coincides with our big upgrade of our base raspberry Pi image. I have a couple of pull requests open, but I think that long-term a database like SQLite where they’ve taken care of all of the hard parts of robustness to power losses probably the correct direction to go

In the interim, I also have a pull request open which packages all the settings up into a single zip file and uses linux’s atomic rename function which seems to be working great at least for 5026

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":58,"updated_at":"2023-03-07T13:30:15.389Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":339,"readers_count":338,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428823,"topic_slug":"psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug","display_username":"Matt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51771,"username":"jsjohn2000","name":"Jason Johnson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a88e57/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37738,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/psa-for-photonvision-teams-settings-loss-bug/428823/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3159385,"name":"jwhite","username":"jwhite","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-07T19:06:01.984Z","cooked":"

We experienced failures similar to this. We weren’t using the april tags in a production fashion, so it was mostly okay. But our experience was that we’d get error messages on a driver station after a few power cycles because the photonvision lib complains if it doesn’t find a connection. One time, we looked at it and discovered that the pi had lost settings. We’d backed up, so it was not hard to put it back on. We have two pis; one with a few week old version and one with the latest. We swapped pis to one with the latest photonvision to see if that would help, and it did not.
I’ve copied off all log / config related things in /opt/photonvision on the first one. The only thing thing I saw happening was a segfault here:
C [libcamera.so.0.0.2+0x118a7c] libcamera::DeviceEnumeratorUdev::addV4L2Device(unsigned long)+0x26c

That seemed to happen in most of the hs_err_pidXXX.log files. Let me know if there is somewhere I can share them that would help.

I may be able to get at the second, more current, pi later today and will see if there seems to be anything interesting in those logs.

Here are some logs from one of our Pis. Unfortunately, I don’t know when the issue occurred so I can’t point you at the right file. logs.zip (51.2 KB)

I did notice that file photonvision-2023-1-31_08-26-29.log has a message about 1 camera remaining unmatched. Interestingly, file photonvision-2023-1-31_08-26-28.log has events with the same timestamps. I don’t know how the date/time is set, but if I didn’t know better, I would think two instances of PV were running simultaneously.

At least from the specs, that looks like a great product. Do you think there are any issues with rule R602?

N.B. As I have written elsewhere, I think R602 is out of date, and FIRST needs to update it:

PhotonVision Beta 2023: AprilTags PhotonVision
Now that USB Power Delivery has become widely available in usb lithium ion battery packs and devices, that should be the FRC standard-- at least in the Standard Power Range. That stays below the 24v limit of custom circuits. And provides plenty of power. I’m contemplating the weight, size, and cost hit of using a laptop as a co-processor so that it can have an independent battery and more computing power than the RPi-type SBCs. But, that is being hard to justify.
Co-processor for upcoming season for vision Programming
Too bad that R602 was not updated to allow for higher power usb-c Power Delivery for USB battery packs. FIRST is behind the times here. Maybe next year.
Co-processor for upcoming season for vision Programming
For example, the MeLe Quieter3c would make a good co-processor and it uses USB Power Delivery and not at 5v. Of course, one could use a converter that uses the main battery for power and provides it over a USB-c PD source. But a modern USB-c pack would provide advantages, such as continuous power before and after the game and additional power. Laptops are allowed to be used and powered by their integrated battery. But, they are large and heavy because of the unnecessary screen and keyboard. Tha…

We tried the UPS out tonight and it worked great! It kept the pi running smoothly for over an hour, even between several battery swaps. There were no low-voltage throttling events reported on the PV settings page.

mmn_slc:

Do you think there are any issues with rule R602?

I’m not expecting it to be an issue. The battery is 4000 mAH at 3.7v, so that’s 14.8 Wh. It’s also an integral part of a COTS computing device. We had an older version of this UPS on our robot in 2018.

@Jon_Stratis Could you comment on any rule issues with this UPS device?
